content.prompt: In the secondary (applied) dominant and its resolution, heard as chords 3 and 4 in the progression, the soprano voice

choices.label: has the leading tone and resolves upward by step
doubles the bass in both chords
has the chordal seventh and resolves downward by step
has nonharmonic tones in both chords

unit.text: 7: Harmony and Voice Leading IV - Secondary Function

topic.text: 7.4: Part Writing of Secondary Leading Tone Chords

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in performed music.
